title: How to Make an Appleflap

steps.headline: Roll out the puff pastry till its about 2mm thick.
Cut the apple into small pieces, and mix the apple pieces with the sugar(you can choose the amount of sugar) and the cinnamon.
Put the apple pieces in a microwave dish and let them cook for a while.
Brush some egg yolk on the edges from the leaf puff pastry.
steps.description: You have to do this because the pastry would be better sealed.

steps.headline: Place a pile of the apple pieces onto the half of the leaf and fold the  leaf diagonally so that its closed.
Press with a fork on the edges so that it's extra sealed.
Brush egg yolk on the entire apple flap and sprinkle some sugar over it.
Bake the apple flap in the oven with a temperature from 225 C°(437 Fahrenheit)  for about 25 minutes until its gold brown.

text: Preheat the oven.  Roll out the puff pastry till its about 2mm thick.  Cut the apple into small pieces, and mix the apple pieces with the sugar(you can choose the amount of sugar) and the cinnamon.  Put the apple pieces in a microwave dish and let them cook for a while.  Brush some egg yolk on the edges from the leaf puff pastry. You have to do this because the pastry would be better sealed. Place a pile of the apple pieces onto the half of the leaf and fold the  leaf diagonally so that its closed.  Press with a fork on the edges so that it's extra sealed.  Brush egg yolk on the entire apple flap and sprinkle some sugar over it.  Bake the apple flap in the oven with a temperature from 225 C°(437 Fahrenheit)  for about 25 minutes until its gold brown.
